arm_group.description:
BMS-986090 0.5 mg solution single dose subcutaneously once
OR
Placebo matching with BMS-986090 0 mg  solution single dose subcutaneously once

BMS-986090 3 mg solution single dose subcutaneously once
OR
Placebo matching with BMS-986090 0 mg  solution single dose subcutaneously once

BMS-986090 10 mg solution single dose subcutaneously once
OR
Placebo matching with BMS-986090 0 mg  solution single dose subcutaneously once

arm_group.arm_group_label: Panel 4: BMS-986090 (30 mg) or Placebo + KLH (1 mg)
arm_group.description:
BMS-986090 30 mg solution single dose subcutaneously once
OR
Placebo matching with BMS-986090 0 mg solution single dose subcutaneously once
And Keyhole limpet hemocyanin (KLH) 1 mg solution single intramuscular dose once

arm_group.arm_group_label: Panel 5: BMS-986090 (100 mg) or Placebo + KLH (1 mg)
arm_group.description:
BMS-986090 100 mg solution single dose subcutaneously once
OR
Placebo matching with BMS-986090 0 mg  solution single dose subcutaneously once
And KLH 1 mg solution single intramuscular dose once

BMS-986090 100 mg solution single dose intravenously once
OR
Placebo matching with BMS-986090 0 mg  solution single dose intravenously once

arm_group.arm_group_label: Panel 7: BMS-986090 (300 mg) or Placebo + KLH (1 mg)
arm_group.description:
BMS-986090 300 mg solution single dose subcutaneously once
OR
Placebo matching with BMS-986090 0 mg  solution single dose subcutaneously once
And KLH 1 mg solution single intramuscular dose once

BMS-986090 750 mg solution single dose intravenously once
OR
Placebo matching with BMS-986090 0 mg  solution single dose intravenously once

BMS-986090 150 mg solution subcutaneously once weekly for 4 weeks
OR
Placebo matching with BMS-986090 0 mg  solution subcutaneously once weekly for 4 weeks

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and tolerability, pharmacokinetics (PK)
      and pharmacodynamics (PD) of BMS-986090 in healthy subjects.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, PK, and PD of CD40 in Healthy Subjects

criteria.textblock:
For more information regarding BMS clinical trial participation, please visit
        www.BMSStudyConnect.com.

        Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Healthy male and female (of not childbearing potential), ages 18-45 years, inclusive

          -  BMI 18 to 32 kg/m2, inclusive

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Any significant acute or chronic medical illness

          -  History of thrombophilia, venous or  arterial thromboembolism (VTE or ATE), including
             history of myocardial infarction (MI), cerebrovascular accident (CVA), pulmonary
             embolism (PE), deep vein thrombosis (DVT)

          -  Known or suspected autoimmune disorder, including but not limited to rheumatoid
             arthritis, fibromyalgia, systemic lupus erythematosis, polymyalgia rheumatica, giant
             cell arteritis, Behcet's disease, dermatomyositis, multiple sclerosis, moderate to
             severe asthma, any autoimmune vasculitis, autoimmune hepatitis, or any other active
             autoimmune disease for which a subject requires medical follow-up or medical
             treatment

          -  Any history of known or suspected congenital or acquired immunodeficiency state or
             condition that would compromise the subject's immune status (e.g.  history of
             splenectomy)

          -  Presence of any factors that would predispose the subject to develop infection e.g.,
             rectal fissures, poor dentition, open skin lesions, and presence of preexisting skin
             conditions that increase risks for injection site complications e.g. Behcet's
             Disease, Psoriasis, pustular dermatoses

clinical_study.official_title: Double-Blinded, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, Single Ascending Dose and Multiple Dose Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of BMS-986090 (Anti-CD40 dAb) in Healthy Subjects

overall_contact.last_name: Recruiting sites have contact information. Please contact the sites directly. If there is no contact information, please email:

overall_contact_backup.last_name: First line of the email MUST contain NCT# and Site #.

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability measured by incidence, potential significance and clinical importance of AEs, as determined by medical review of AE reports, vital sign measurements, ECGs and results of physical examination and laboratory tests
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Day 85 after single dose of BMS-986090

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum observed serum concentration (Cmax) of BMS-986090 single dose subcutaneous (SC) and intravenous (IV)
Time of maximum observed serum concentration (Tmax) of single dose BMS-986090 SC and IV
Area under the serum concentration-time curve from time zero to time of last quantifiable concentration [AUC(0-T)] of single dose BMS-986090 SC and IV
Area under the serum concentration-time curve from time zero extrapolated to infinite time [AUC(INF)] of single dose BMS-986090 SC and IV
Terminal serum half-life (T-HALF) of single dose BMS-986090 SC and IV
Total body clearance (CLT) of single dose BMS-986090 IV
Apparent total body clearance (CLT/F) of single dose BMS-986090 SC
Volume of distribution at terminal phase (Vz) of single dose BMS-986090 IV
Volume of distribution during steady state (Vss) of single dose BMS-986090 IV
Apparent volume of distribution at terminal phase (Vz/F) of single dose BMS-986090 SC
Absolute bioavailability (F) of single dose BMS-986090 SC
Maximum observed serum concentration (Cmax) of multiple dose BMS-986090 SC
Time of maximum observed serum concentration (Tmax) of multiple dose BMS-986090 SC
Terminal serum half-life (T-HALF) of multiple dose BMS-986090 SC
Area under the serum concentration-time curve in one dosing Interval [AUC(TAU)] of multiple dose BMS-986090 SC
Trough observed plasma concentration (Ctrough) of multiple dose BMS-986090 SC
Average concentration over a dosing interval (Css-avg) of multiple dose BMS-986090 SC
Degree of Fluctuation (DF) of multiple dose BMS-986090 SC
AUC accumulation index (AI_AUC); ratio of AUC(TAU) at steady state to AUC(TAU) after the first dose of BMS-986090 SC (multiple dose)
Cmax accumulation index (AI_Cmax); ratio of Cmax at steady state to Cmax after the first dose of BMS-986090 SC (multiple dose)
Apparent total body clearance (CLT/F) of multiple dose BMS-986090 SC
Anti-KLH immunoglobulin G (IgG) and IgM antibody levels of single dose BMS-986090 SC

Immunogenicity of BMS-986090 following single SC / IV infusion measured by frequency of subjects with positive anti-drug-antibody (ADA) assessment and frequency of subjects who develop positive ADA following a negative baseline
Receptor occupancy (RO) of BMS-986090 following single SC or IV infusion

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Basic Science
